Findings of Fact, Rulings of Law, and Order for Partial Separate and Final Judgment

evidence.text: b. Executive Order 14151 On January 20, 2025, the President issued Executive Order No. 14151, entitled 'Ending Radical and Wasteful Government DEI Programs and Preferencing.' Exec. Order 14151, 90 Fed. Reg. 8339 (Jan. 20, 2025) (“EO 14151”).
evidence.source_document: Findings of Fact, Rulings of Law, and Order for Partial Separate and Final Judgment

add_extracted.value: President issued Executive Order 14151 on January 20, 2025.

evidence.text: b. Executive Order 14168 On January 20, 2025, the President also issued Executive Order 14168, 'Defending Women from Gender Ideology Extremism and Restoring Biological Truth to the Federal Government.' Exec. Order 14168, 90 Fed. Reg. 8615 (Jan. 20, 2025) (“EO 14168”).
evidence.source_document: Findings of Fact, Rulings of Law, and Order for Partial Separate and Final Judgment

add_extracted.value: President issued Executive Order 14168 on January 20, 2025.

evidence.text: c. Executive Order 14173 On January 21, 2025, President issued Executive Order No. 14173, entitled 'Ending Illegal Discrimination and Restoring Merit-Based Opportunity.' Exec. Order 14173, 90 Fed. Reg. 8633 (Jan. 21, 2025) (“EO 14173”).
evidence.source_document: Findings of Fact, Rulings of Law, and Order for Partial Separate and Final Judgment

add_extracted.value: President issued Executive Order 14173 on January 21, 2025.

evidence.text: 3. February 10, 2025 – The Secretarial Directive – Challenged Directive 2 On February 10, 2025, Acting Secretary Fink, issued the following 'Secretarial Directive on DEI-Related Funding' ('the Secretarial Directive').
evidence.source_document: Findings of Fact, Rulings of Law, and Order for Partial Separate and Final Judgment

add_extracted.value: Acting Secretary Fink issued the Secretarial Directive on DEI‑Related Funding on February 10, 2025.

evidence.source_document: Findings of Fact, Rulings of Law, and Order for Partial Separate and Final Judgment

add_extracted.value: The Lauer Memoranda were issued on February 12, 2025.

evidence.source_document: Findings of Fact, Rulings of Law, and Order for Partial Separate and Final Judgment

add_extracted.value: The Lauer Memoranda were issued on February 13, 2025.

evidence.text: 8. February 28, 2025 – The Grant Terminations Begin On February 28, 2025, the first batch-terminations occurred.
evidence.source_document: Findings of Fact, Rulings of Law, and Order for Partial Separate and Final Judgment

add_extracted.value: The first batch of grant terminations began on February 28, 2025.

evidence.text: The March 25 Guidance settled on an examples list of: 'China,' 'DEI,' 'Transgender issues,' 'Vaccine Hesitancy', 'COVID-related' research.
evidence.source_document: Findings of Fact, Rulings of Law, and Order for Partial Separate and Final Judgment

add_extracted.value: The March 25, 2025 Staff Guidance (Priorities Directive) listed examples including China, DEI, Transgender issues, Vaccine Hesitancy, and COVID‑related research.

evidence.text: The Court has found as fact that there was pervasive racial discrimination in selecting grants for termination.
evidence.source_document: Findings of Fact, Rulings of Law, and Order for Partial Separate and Final Judgment

add_extracted.value: The Court found pervasive racial discrimination in selecting grants for termination.

evidence.text: The Court finds by the fair preponderance of the evidence that the grant terminations here at issue demonstrate an unmistakable pattern of discrimination against women’s health issues.
evidence.source_document: Findings of Fact, Rulings of Law, and Order for Partial Separate and Final Judgment

add_extracted.value: The Court found gender discrimination in grant terminations.

evidence.text: The Court’s factual finding that there has been extensive discrimination against everyone whose lived experience of their sexuality is in any way different from the executive orthodoxy expressed in the President’s fiat, see Exec. Order 14168, 90 Fed. Reg. 8615 (Jan. 20, 2025), is fully affirmed.
evidence.source_document: Findings of Fact, Rulings of Law, and Order for Partial Separate and Final Judgment

add_extracted.value: The Court found LGBTQ+ discrimination in grant terminations.

evidence.text: The actions were randomly reassigned to this Court on May 1, 2025.
evidence.source_document: Findings of Fact, Rulings of Law, and Order for Partial Separate and Final Judgment

add_extracted.value: Consolidated actions were randomly reassigned to this Court on May 1, 2025.

evidence.text: American Public Health Association; Ibis Reproductive Health; International Union, United Automobile, Aerospace, and Agricultural Implement Workers; Dr. Brittany Charlton; Dr. Katie Edwards; Dr. Peter Lurie; Dr. Nicole Maphis;
evidence.source_document: Findings of Fact, Rulings of Law, and Order for Partial Separate and Final Judgment

add_extracted.value: Plaintiffs include American Public Health Association, Ibis Reproductive Health, International Union, United Automobile, Aerospace, and Agricultural Implement Workers, Dr. Brittany Charlton, Dr. Katie Edwards, Dr. Peter Lurie, and Dr. Nicole Maphis.

evidence.text: National Institutes of Health; JAY BHATTACHARYA; JAYANTA BHATTACHARYA; National Institutes of Health; National Cancer Institute; National Eye Institute; National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute;
evidence.source_document: Findings of Fact, Rulings of Law, and Order for Partial Separate and Final Judgment

add_extracted.value: Defendants include National Institutes of Health, JAY BHATTACHARYA, JAYANTA BHATTACHARYA, National Institutes of Health, National Cancer Institute, National Eye Institute, National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute, and other NIH institutes.
